heaviest_rainfall.status: 47.89mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 09 November 2025, marking an exceptional 144.8 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 24.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 34.3mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 09 November 2025, it lasted 144.8 hours and it delivered 47.89mm of rain at a maximum rate of 24.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: There are no active storms in the area.  The previous storm started on 07 February 2026 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 3 cold snaps, with an average of 3.6 per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 0 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (197°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 128.2 mph on 27 January 2026.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description: Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 3.0°C) and outside temperature (down 2.9°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.3 mm).

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 32.6m higher than yesterday, 32.1m higher than the past week, 37.4m higher than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 608m and a high of 970m, averaging 809.5m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; cold temperatures are forecasted. Also, the air will feel dry and little or no wind. Possible light showers, the sky will be mostly cloudy (or even foggy) with low clouds, and it’s dark. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.

washing.phrase: It is nighttime; if you have washing out then bring it in as it will probably get damper overnight.
